data.md:MetaData: Tab. 2: Vegetation and climate reconstruction for the last 60 kyr on the Bykovsky Peninsula
Laptev sea coast, coastal and thermokarst erosion has created up to 40 m high coastal cliffs, trending NNW-SSE, and extending intermittently for about 2 km.
Paleoenvironmental changes in northeastern Siberia during the Late Quaternary - evidence from pollen records of the Bykovsky Peninsula
